alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Lee; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:24AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ogle, northern Lee and northwestern De Kalb Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 424 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Coleta to Oregon to near Byron. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dixon, Rochelle, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Davis Junction, Kirkland, Forreston, Hillcrest, Malta, Kingston, Stillman Valley, Franklin Grove, Ashton, Lost Nation, Creston, Lindenwood, Monroe Center and Leaf River. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 94 and 114. I-88 between mile markers 45 and 87. This includes... Castle Rock State Park, Lee County Fairgrounds, Lowden State Park, Ogle County Fairgrounds, Sauk Valley College, and White Pines State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for north central Illinois.
